text: Hallie Anderson (January 5, 1885 – November 9, 1927) was an American dance orchestra conductor and theater band director during the Harlem Renaissance.Southern, Eileen. The Music of Black Americans: A History. New York: W. W. Norton & Company, 1997, Anderson was born in Lynchburg, Virginia, and died in New York City in 1927.. ==References== Category:1885 births Category:1927 deaths Category:People from Lynchburg, Virginia
title: Hallie Anderson
